issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

When AdGuard is turned off, the scrollbar returns. This seems to be a recent issue, as this has never happened a few weeks ago. ### Screenshots

Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion

Language-specific:
AdGuard French,
AdGuard Chinese Browsing Security: | disabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Other extensions used: | `Adobe acrobat, Urban VPN `

comment.body:
Fixed in - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/73d3c00da095af151fd6613ea12355f1019338cc

The problem is that the MV3 extension cannot update filters due to a Google policy. Therefore, the new rules will be available in an upcoming extension update.
Until then, please add following rules to user rules:
```adblock
pinterest.*#$#body[style="overflow: hidden;"] { overflow: auto !important; }
pinterest.*#%#//scriptlet('prevent-setTimeout', '/.\(Array\.from\(document\.querySelectorAll\(.\)\)\.some\(.=>.\(.\)&&!.\(.\)\)\)\}|.\(Array\.from\(document\.querySelectorAll\(.\)\)\.some\(.=>.*checkVisibility/')
```

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
> [#203236 (comment)](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/203236#issuecomment-3123398219)
> 
> ユーザーフィルタに以下を追加し、ブラウザのキャッシュを削除してYoutubeを再読み込みしてみてください。
> 
> ```
> /\.com\/watch\?|\.com\/playlist\?list=|\/youtubei\/v.*\/(get_watch|player)\?/$xmlhttprequest,replace=/"(adPlacements|adSlots|playerAds)"/"no_ads"/,domain=youtubekids.com|youtube-nocookie.com|youtube.com,badfilter
> /player?$xmlhttprequest,replace=/"(adPlacements|adSlots)"/"no_ads"/,domain=youtube.com
> youtube.com#@%#//scriptlet('json-prune-fetch-response', 'playerResponse.adPlacements playerResponse.playerAds playerResponse.adSlots adPlacements playerAds adSlots', '', '/playlist\?list=|player\?|watch\?[tv]=|get_watch\?/')
> youtube.com#%#//scriptlet('json-prune-fetch-response', 'playerResponse.adPlacements playerResponse.adSlots adPlacements adSlots', '', 'player?')
> ```

This [youtube.com#@%#//scriptlet('json-prune-fetch-response', 'playerResponse.adPlacements playerResponse.playerAds playerResponse.adSlots adPlacements playerAds adSlots', '', '/playlist\?list=|player\?|watch\?[tv]=|get_watch\?/')] works, thank you!

comment.body:
As far as I can see, these ads are fixed by JS rule (which is not supported by uBO).
And in the case of Firefox extension, this JS rule is not available in the filters yet (it should be available in the one of the next extension updates), but adding it to user rules fixes ads.
```adblock
mega.nz#%#(()=>{if(!location.href.includes("/embed/"))return;const e={get(e,t,r){try{return"disabled"===t&&"function"==typeof e.start?(queueMicrotask((()=>{try{e.start()}catch(e){}})),!0):Reflect.get(e,t,r)}catch(c){return Reflect.get(e,t,r)}}},t={apply:(t,r,c)=>{try{const n=Reflect.apply(t,r,c);if(n&&"object"==typeof n){if((()=>{try{return(new Error).stack||""}catch{return""}})().includes("getVideoAdInstance"))return new Proxy(n,e)}return n}catch(e){return Reflect.apply(t,r,c)}}};window.Object.create=new Proxy(window.Object.create,t)})();
```

So I guess we can close it.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://facebook.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Ffacebook.com) ### Comment > After recent app update the Facebook won't load with adguard enabled neither on Chrome or Firefox. It just loads the white screen. Disabling entire Adguard or just Adguard Tracking Protection Filter fixes the issue. However it's very annoying that it needs to be done every time. comment.body:
Could you please try to manually update filters and then check again? If problem still continues please open filter editor, open `AdGuard Tracking Protection filter`, search for `facebook`, select all rules (Ctrl+A), click right mouse button on any of the rule, disable all of them temporary, wait few seconds until changes will be applied and check if problem still occurs.
Screenshot

issue.title: Clean up rules for op.gg
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

OP.GG changed their domain handling a while ago. Specifically, they unified all domains to op.gg by removing subdomains, even for tracker sites for titles other than League of Legends, such as tft.op.gg. As a result, the rules with subdomains included in the filter are not working.

www.op.gg
tft.op.gg
na.op.gg
valorant.op.gg
overwatch.op.gg


### Proposed solution

I think the rules with subdomains should be fixed. Also, I think it's necessary to remove any rules that are now outdated.

### Additional information

_No response_

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

Not reproduced on my end.
Enable AdGuard Chinese, then try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
> Could you please try to manually update filters and then check again? If problem still continues please open filter editor, open `AdGuard Tracking Protection filter`, search for `facebook`, select all rules (Ctrl+A), click right mouse button on any of the rule, disable all of them temporary, wait few seconds until changes will be applied and check if problem still occurs.
> 
> Screenshot

That didn't fix it. But thanks anyway.

I found the solution... adding FB as an exception to HTTPS filtering. This allows fb to load normally on both Chrome and Firefox, however with loads of ads present :(

Any ideas?

comment.body:
Adding `facebook.com` to HTTPS exceptions is like disabling filtering.
Please try to add following rules one by one (if the one rule does not work, please disable/remove it and check the next one):
1. Rule:
```adblock
@@||facebook.com^$permissions
```
2. Rule:
```adblock
@@||facebook.com^$elemhide,important
```
3. Rule:
```adblock
@@||facebook.com^$urlblock
```
4. Rule:
```adblock
@@||facebook.com^$elemhide,jsinject,extension
```

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://emojipedia.org/grinning-squinting-face](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Femojipedia.org%2Fgrinning-squinting-face) ### Comment > The issue is only present in Firefox, Chrome is unaffected. > > When AdGuard is enabled, content flashes for a moment, then the page goes empty. I added into my user rules everything that showed up in the Filtering log in red: > > ``` > @@||a.pub.network/emojipedia-org/ > @@||emojipedia.org > @@||googletagmanager.com/gtag/js > @@||sdk.privacy-center.org/sdk/$domain=emojipedia.org > ``` > > Now there are no red/orange entries in the log, but the page still goes empty upon refresh or hard refresh (Ctrl+F5). > > I tried to switch from AdGuard DNS to System default, no effect. > > When AdGuard is disabled, the page loads all right in Firefox even with uBlock Origin enabled. > > I tried going through the list of my subscribed filters, turning them off one-by-one, to see which one may be catching it, and at some point the page did load, but that seemed like an one-off random event, because when I turned the same filter on and off again, it broke again. ``` Username: @kazerniel ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/ddynt9jma5koc8csw4wkc08w0g40o48gzczqnw6oyo.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/9j4bexywqt4ww0k8ggcs8co80kowsc8opkj071qzzk.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/d9fe7l10d7kks0g08kk08w4kk8oo4403evqsvme3fc.png?nc=1)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://emojipedia.org/grinning-squinting-face](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Femojipedia.org%2Fgrinning-squinting-face) ### Comment > The issue is only present in Firefox, Chrome is unaffected. > > When AdGuard is enabled, content flashes for a moment, then the page goes empty. I added into my user rules everything that showed up in the Filtering log in red: > > ``` > @@||a.pub.network/emojipedia-org/ > @@||emojipedia.org > @@||googletagmanager.com/gtag/js > @@||sdk.privacy-center.org/sdk/$domain=emojipedia.org > ``` > > Now there are no red/orange entries in the log, but the page still goes empty upon refresh or hard refresh (Ctrl+F5). > > I tried to switch from AdGuard DNS to System default, no effect. > > When AdGuard is disabled, the page loads all right in Firefox even with uBlock Origin enabled. > > I tried going through the list of my subscribed filters, turning them off one-by-one, to see which one may be catching it, and at some point the page did load, but that seemed like an one-off random event, because when I turned the same filter on and off again, it broke again. ``` Username: @kazerniel ``` ### Screenshots

issue.title: facebook.com

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://facebook.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Ffacebook.com) ### Comment > After recent app update the Facebook won't load with adguard enabled neither on Chrome or Firefox. It just loads the white screen. Disabling entire Adguard or just Adguard Tracking Protection Filter fixes the issue. However it's very annoying that it needs to be done every time. Especially that it worked without extra steps until the recent app/filter update. Not sure which one broke it. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/qlvuxsxyig0kgwwgc0coko8s8cgow84k896lk0rkqo.jpg?nc=1)

comment.body:
> Adding `facebook.com` to HTTPS exceptions is like disabling filtering. Please try to add following rules one by one (if the one rule does not work, please disable/remove it and check the next one):
> 
> 1. Rule:
> 
> @@||facebook.com^$permissions
> 2. Rule:
> 
> @@||facebook.com^$elemhide,important
> 3. Rule:
> 
> @@||facebook.com^$urlblock
> 4. Rule:
> 
> @@||facebook.com^$elemhide,jsinject,extension

No luck with the rules. There's something else that I noticed. If I keep refreshing the FB page it will sometimes load. It is random and not consistent.

comment.body: @AdamWr Though it's player's own issue, if you soft-reload and play with default Server 1, the play button will remain and controls won't be available. This seems to be due to `Uncaught TypeError: Cannot set properties of undefined (setting 'currentLevel')`, and if you watch on the frame itself, can be fixed with `pantieshub.net#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'hls', 'emptyObj')`. But if you watch as embed, this no longer works.

comment.body:
Basing on HAR rather nothing can be done.
I can just update a rule to remove ad segments, but when only ad segments are served, then freezing/buffering is rather not fixable (even if it would be replaced by other `.ts` segments, it still be necessary to wait as website serve content without ads).
